subject: Re: how to skip a test at runtime
msgSnippet: Mike, ... Having a common platform that runs it all is good. Unit tests and using JUnit overgrew developer-only testing long ago. Sooner (better) or later
messageBody:
Mike,

> I'm curious about how (why?) "QA" is using JUnit tests.

Having a common platform that runs it all is good. Unit tests and
using JUnit overgrew "developer-only" testing long ago. Sooner
(better) or later they become functional tests, user acceptance tests
and what not.

So, to me limiting test run by QA is a natural requirements. We use
Ant's <batchtest if="..."> to select what test groups should be run in
a particular case.

HTH

Regards,

Slava Imeshev
